results.title: Sarah: the seventh match
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross Films and Yoram Gross
results.brief_description: This animated video tells the story of ten year old Sarah, who, separated from her family by the sudden outbreak of war, hides in the woods. She gradually adapts to her wild surroundings and becomes more like the forest creatures. Believing she can end the war by sabotaging a strategic railway bridge, Sarah begins the dangerous task of prising bricks from the bridge’s support columns. When her task seems hopeless and she is exhausted, spring floods bring ice floes crashing into the weakened columns, destroying the bridge. Sarah, her work done and now aware of mankind’s ability to hate and kill, returns forever to the forest and the creatures of the wild.

results.title: Sarah plain and tall
results.brief_description: Set in Kansas in 1910 this film concerns an independent woman, Sarah Wheaton (Glenn Close), who answers an advertisement for help wanted by a widower with two children in Midwest America. It is a transformation from the comfortable security of her seacoast home to the harsh terrain of the “wild west”. Also starring Christopher Walken, Lexi Randall and Margaret Sophie Stein. Based on the novel of the same name by Patricia MacLachlan.

results.title: Sarah Brown's Vegetarian Kitchen
results.brief_description: Sarah Brown tempts the tastebuds with a collection of mouth-watering recipes which will appeal to both vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. This video shows you how to prepare a variety of delicious dishes which are not only healthy and economical, but also attractive and imaginative. Rated: G

results.title: Saraband for dead lovers
results.creator_credit: Ealing Studios, Rank Film Productions, Sir Michael Balcon and Basil Dearden
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
George the Ist of England came from the small independent German state of Hanover and when he succeeded to the throne of England, he left behind a prisoner in the Castle of Ahlden, Princess Sophia Dorothea, his wife. She married George Louis against her will and this is a tragic tale full of melodrama, intrigue and spectacle. The costumes and settings alike will delight. Stewart Granger, Joan Greenwood, Francoise Rosay, Flora Robson, Anthony Quayle and Michael Gough star in this period drama based on a novel by Helen Simpson.

results.title: Sara Dane
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Jock Blair
results.brief_description: Based on the best selling novel by Catherine Gaskin, “Sara Dane” portrays the rags to riches story of a young servant girl transported to New South Wales for a crime she did not commit. Rated: PG

results.title: Sappy homiens
results.brief_description: The carton character Sappy Homiens learns the seven danger signals which indicate cancer and discovers the importance of having annual physical checkups in the absence of symptoms. Explains what cancer is, how is spreads, and why early discovery and treatment are important.

results.title: Sapphire
results.creator_credit: Artna, Basil Relph and Basil Dearden
results.brief_description: Investigation into the murder of a music student, Sapphire Robbins, leads the detectives along London’s coloured population. Although she passed for white, Sapphire was half Negro, and her dark-skinned brother is one of several suspects. When the detective expose, in all its irrationality, the violent hate that Sapphire managed to arouse, the murderer is driven into a confession. The extract is taken halfway through the film when the police investigation is underway and various people who have known Sapphire Robbins are being questioned. Det Hazard (Nigel Patrick), Det Learoyd (Michael Craig), David Farris (Paul Massie), Mildred Harris (Yvonne Mitchell), Mr Harris (Bernard Miles), Mrs Harris (Olga Lindo), Dr Robbins (Earl Cameron), Paul Slade (Gordon Heath).

results.title: Sappers K9: the dogs of war
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations and Vincent Donovan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Concealed explosives have maimed and killed Australians in military conflict and society because they do not necessarily incorporate metallic components and are undetectable by conventional machines. The use of a special breed of German Shepherd dog by the Royal Australian Engineers promises greater security.

results.title: Santiago's ark
results.brief_description: A New York tenement if Spanish-Harlem is not an easy place to live in. One moves fast and grows up quickly because that’s survival. But one learns to cope with the ghetto and sometimes can transform rubbish into beauty. Santiago’s Ark is such a place of beauty for a boy and his dreams. With endurance and help of the people around him, he sets about building his own ship on the rooftop of his apartment house.
